meanings.definition: To be filled with wonder or astonishment
meanings.sent1: She marveled at the colorful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The children marveled at the magician's tricks.
meanings.sent3: The cat marveled at the sudden appearance of a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The explorer marveled at the vastness of the desert.
meanings.sent5: The students marveled at the teacher's surprising announcement.

meanings.definition: To admire or be amazed by something
meanings.sent1: He marveled at the intricate details of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The audience marveled at the talented singer's performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef marveled at the unique combination of flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent4: She marveled at the strength of the tiny ant carrying a large crumb.
meanings.sent5: The athlete marveled at the speed of his opponent during the race.
